Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of PLX-PAD in Chronic Limb-Threatening Ischaemia

Participants.evidence: patients with CLTI and minor tissue loss

Intervention.evidence: 30 intramuscular injections into the index leg on days 0 and 60

Objective.evidence: evaluated the efficacy of PLX-PAD, a placental-derived mesenchymal stromal cell-like therapy, in increasing amputation-free survival (AFS)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was AFS, measured from randomisation to major amputation or death, over 12-36 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using permuted blocks, and allocation was concealed via an interactive web-based system.

Blinding.evidence: Patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between September 2017 and November 2020, 143 patients were randomised to PLX-PAD and 70 to placebo.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on 205 patients using an intention-to-treat approach.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were reported in 73.5% of PLX-PAD and 82.6% of placebo patients
